bioghist.p: Thomas Gates, Jr., (1906-1983) served in several positions in the U.S. government over his long career. He was Secretary of the Navy from 1957-1959 and Secretary of Defense from 1959-1961. He was ambassador to China from 1976-1977. His father, Thomas S. Gates, Sr., was President of the University of Pennsylvania from 1930-1944.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains materials related to Gates's military and government service, as well as his other professional and personal activities. Materials include: night order books and other log books related to naval operations during World War II; correspondence, including letters from Eisenhower; appointment books and call logs; numerous awards, citations, medals from army, government and diplomatic service; materials related to Gates's assignment to China; and albums that include family photographs, photographs from military service, and mementos given to Gates during trips to various countries.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
